metadata.Title: CVE-2012-3535 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in OpenJPEG 1.5.0 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted JPEG2000 file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-3535` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjpeg2 - 1.3+dfsg-4.6ubuntu1
openjpeg-tools - 1.3+dfsg-4.6ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3+dfsg-4.6ubuntu1').
